texts.text: Pocket Edition v0.12.1 alpha

v0.12.1 is a major update to Minecraft: Pocket Edition that was released over the timeframe of September 4–9, 2015. It added many new things such as the Nether, brewing, enchanting, hunger, weather, and much more. Due to these additions, the game began to emulate Java Edition better, though it still lacked several key functions such as redstone mechanics and other features at the time.

The release was initially intended to coincide with the release of the Windows 10 Edition on July 29, 2015, when it was announced at MINECON 2015. However, it encountered obstacles in its development in the days leading up to its intended release date, forcing it to be delayed, so, therefore, this is the first version of 0.12 to be on Pocket Edition.[1]
Contents

1 Additions
1.1 Blocks
1.2 Items
1.3 Mobs
1.4 World generation
1.5 Gameplay
1.6 General
2 Changes
2.1 Blocks
2.2 Items
2.3 Mobs
2.4 World generation
2.5 Gameplay
2.6 General
3 Fixes
4 References
Additions
Blocks
Enchanting table

Version exclusive: Book on table glows.
Version exclusive: Custom name does not appear in GUI.
Anvils

All 3 damage types.
Version exclusive: furnaces, enchantment tables, and brewing stands with a custom name do not have their custom name in their GUIs.
Brewing stand
Version exclusive: Custom name does not appear in GUI.
Mob head

Version exclusive: Inventory icons are not 3D.
Wither cannot yet be created.
Cannot be worn.

Flower pot
Soul sand
Nether brick fence
Nether brick slab
Nether quartz ore
Items

Glass bottles
Potion
Splash potion

Gold nugget
Golden carrot
Nether wart
Glistering melon
Golden apple
Enchanted golden apple
Rabbit's foot
(Creative only as rabbits have not been added yet.)

Blaze rod
Blaze powder
Ghast tear
Spider eye
Fermented spider eye
Bottle o' enchanting
(Creative only as villager trading has not been added yet.)

Poisonous potato
Enchanted book
Spawn eggs

Blaze
Ocelot
A lot of items have been added to the Creative inventory, mostly those that already exist in the game. This includes the following

Glowstone dust
Gunpowder
Redstone dust
Not yet placeable.
Slimeball
Sugar
Magma cream
Apple
Coal
Charcoal
Iron ingot
Gold ingot
Emerald
Diamond
Raw porkchop
Cooked porkchop
Steak
Raw chicken
Cooked chicken
Baked potato
Bread
String
Stick
Beetroot
Beetroot soup
Mushroom soup
Packed ice
Boats:
Spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, and dark oak variants.
Leather armor
Chain armor
Iron armor
Gold armor
Diamond armor
Mobs

Iron golems
Snow golems
JE 1.9 Feature: The pumpkin can be removed using shears, revealing the face of the snow golem.
Ocelots
Zombie villagers
JE 1.9 Feature: Villagers retain their profession and clothes, which appear tattered, and have a green wart on their noses.
Baby zombie villagers
Blazes
Wither skeletons
Charged creepers
Spawned when a lightning bolt strikes a creeper during a thunderstorm.
World generation

The Nether
Infinite in size, like in Java Edition.
Nether portals can also be up to 23x23 in size.
All items previously obtained through the Nether reactor are now available through their normal means.
Nether fortresses
Gameplay

Hunger
Experience
Weather
Rain
Snowfall
Thunderstorm
Sprinting
Sneaking
Toggled by double-tapping the sneak button.
Was previously available only on the Xperia PLAY gaming console.
4 difficulty modes
Peaceful
Easy
Normal
Hard
Animation for switching blocks and items
Critical hits
Enchanting
Brewing
Item repair
General

Cross-platform play for up to five players between Pocket Edition and Windows 10.
Controller and keyboard support
Can change controls within options.
Options
Version exclusive: Option to reverse the Sneak and Jump button's location.
The jump button has been moved to the right side of the screen.
Added a sneaking button in place of where the current jump button is.
These are the new default controls.
Option to disable the auto-jump feature.
Added camera mode slider on options (First-person, Third-person, Front third-person).
FOV option slider.[2]
New interact buttons
Feed
Used when breeding mobs.
The "feed" button previously existed for wolves; now, it exists for all breedable mobs.
Splashes
"So fresh, so clean!"
Particles
angryVillager
largeexplode
hugeexplode
blockdust
slime
enchantementtable
droplet
snowshovel
Changes
Blocks

Nether reactor core
Uncraftable
Removed from the crafting menu and the creative inventory.
Still provides drops when broken (3 diamonds and 6 iron ingots).
Only obtainable via inventory editing.
It no longer functions.
Furnace
Centered the result name in the furnace.
Snow layer
Version exclusive: Builds up multiple layers naturally through snowfall.
Version exclusive: Are now affected by gravity.
Crops
Breaking crops will now always drop seeds.
Lava
Version exclusive: Now appears brighter.
Now prevents fall damage.
When in the Nether, it now flows like in Java Edition.
Water
Improved water climbing against a wall.
Now makes it harder to break blocks underwater.
Door
Can now be stacked up to 64.
Crafting now produces 3 doors rather than 1.
Packed ice
New texture:
Quartz pillars
Can now be placed horizontally.
Dead bush
Will now drop anywhere between 0–2 sticks when broken without shears.
End portal frame
Now rotate based on the direction they were placed.
Trapdoors
Can now be placed on the bottom and top side of a block.
Ladders
Can now be hung on while sneaking.
Items

Boat
New inventory icons.
Now include paddles.
Different boat types' items now are their respective color.
Food
Now restores hunger instead of health.
Pufferfish
Now inflicts the following status effects:
Poison IV (1:00)
Hunger III (0:15)
Nausea (0:15)
All rotten foods
Now inflict the player with Hunger due to the addition of hunger, rather than Poison in 0.11.0.
Beetroot
Beetroot crops can be obtained from village farms.
Beetroot seeds can no longer be obtained by tilling grass blocks.
Seeds
Seeds can no longer be obtained by tilling grass blocks.
Book
Now use the updated crafting recipe, including leather.
Spawn egg
Mobs spawned from renamed eggs have the name of the egg, and the names will appear in death messages.
Zombie spawn eggs now have a chance to spawn zombie villagers.
Swords
Can no longer break blocks in Creative mode.
Magma cream
Can now be crafted.
Mobs

All mobs
Burning mobs have a sizzling particle effect once extinguished.
Mobs now drop experience when killed.
Improved AI
Improved pathfinding of mobs inside fences.
Now seek water and shade when on fire.
Now avoid lava.
Zombie
Now wears different armor and can hold items.
Now drops weapons and armor rarely.
Can now break down doors.
Drops its head if killed by a charged creeper.
Now able to detect the player up to 40 blocks.
Now drops iron ingots.
Skeleton
Now wears different armor and can hold items.
Improved accuracy.
Now drops weapons and armor rarely.
Can turn into a wither skeleton if spawned in the Nether.
Drops its head if killed by a charged creeper.
Death sound changed to that of Java Edition.
Creeper
Now turn into charged creepers when struck by lightning.
Now drops its head when killed by a charged creeper.
Run away from ocelots (wild and tamed variants).
Enderman
Now avoids water.
Slime
Now have particles when jumping.
Now drop slimeballs.
Magma cube
Now spawn in the Nether.
Magma cubes now split when killed.
Now have particles when jumping.
Zombie pigman
Now neutral rather than hostile.
Now spawns in the Nether.
Now wears armor and can hold items.
Now drops swords and armor rarely.
Now drops gold nuggets.
Have a chance to spawn with enchanted swords.
Villager
Can now open and close doors.
Can now harvest crops.
Can now breed.
Now has angry particles if attacked by the player.
Now always become zombie villagers in Hard difficulty.
Zombie villagers can be healed using a splash potion of Weakness and a golden apple.
Spider
Now have a walking sound.
Now drops spider eyes.
Cave Spider
Now has a walking sound.
Now drops spider eyes.
Ghast
Now spawns in the Nether.
Now drops a ghast tear when killed.
Now makes sounds and noises.
Increased size of hitbox.
Pig
Now turns into zombie pigman when struck by lightning.
Wolves
Tamed wolves now attack target when it was hit with a bow.
Silverfish
No longer makes sounds while moving.
World generation

Villages
Now spawn with only wheat + one other crop instead of all crops.
Now spawn with beetroot crops.
Will now spawn iron golems
Gameplay

Controls
Flight controls are now slightly smaller.
Chat
The player can now use the chat while in a bed.
Slight jump delay when jumping in a small space.
Blocks can now be placed underneath the player while sneaking.
When tapping a block, the moving hand animation is displayed every time, not just when placing a block.
Hotbar now has 8 slots instead of 5.
General

Changed game logo.
Graphics
Tinted water - gradient from aqua to dark blue when viewed from a distance.
New explosion particles.
Particles are no longer dark when inside of a block.
Version exclusive: Leaves in snowy taigas now appear frost-covered.
Only uses the leaves coloring shaders when the color for a biome actually changes.
Only samples the lightmap texture for non-transparent pixels.
Scrollbar
Always visible.
New texture.
The player can now swim in lava.
Updated sounds
Changed the volume of some sounds.
Updated the sound engine, which supports multiple sounds at once, and fixed pitch and volume issues for android versions.
New sound for dying skeletons and wither skeletons.
Digging and walking sounds are now the same as in Java Edition.
Explosion and item throwing sounds changed.
Damage sounds changed to that of the Java Edition tick instead of the masculine (oof) sound.
Fishing rod now makes a less repetitive sound.
Ladders now make sounds when climbing.
Water and lava now make sounds when flowing.
Name tags are visible from farther away now.
New random seed algorithm.
Better ordering on chunk scheduling.
Options
Third person view switch replaced with a slider bar, with 3 options:
Option 1 - first-person view
Option 2 - third-person view
Option 3 - frontal face view
Renamed D-Pad size slider to "Button size".
Custom server IPs must be unique.
Relocated pause and chat button to top middle of the screen. (survival only)
Trying to connect to old versions of the game, like 0.11 or under, will show an error message.
Fixes
72 bugs fixed
Touchpad implementation fixed on the Sony Xperia Play
From released versions before 0.12.1

MCPE-3671 – You can't get out of lava[3]

MCPE-5200 - Bug while mining/breaking blocks (Touch and Split Controls)
MCPE-5541 - Can't place pillar quartz blocks sideways
MCPE-6263 - Bows don't have particles in full charge.
MCPE-6806 - Automatic Flying Bug
MCPE-6854 - Auto jump doesn't work with carpet
MCPE-6882 - Finger free mining bug.
MCPE-6886 - Wrong Crops Sound
MCPE-6998 - When tapping the leftmost box in hotbar while walking forward, you walk backward-left a bit.
MCPE-7745 - Acacia and dark oak trees act like ladders

MCPE-8575 - Skeletons Aim is off

MCPE-8853 - Carpet duplication when trying to place it where it cannot be placed
MCPE-8855 - Minecarts Wrong View when riding it down

MCPE-8333 - Not translate in RU lang for blocks
MCPE-8359 - Custom Skins Crash
MCPE-8365 - Wrong death position-VIDEO
References
"So, we actually wanted to release MCPE on the 29th, but it would have no Enchanting, Music and Controller support... so August, hopefully :)" – @_tomcc on Twitter, July 20, 2015
"Hey, a Field of View (FOV) option got added!" – @shoghicp on Twitter, July 31, 2015
"It should be fixed in 0.12 :)" – u/mojang_tommo on Reddit, July 25, 2015
